column1: Common Bond Bistro & Bakery - Montrose////Bathrooms. In a single hour visit a few weeks ago
column2: I was one of seven mothers with infants. Guess what? No changing table is provided
column3: even with plenty of bathroom wall space for one. So
column4: like the other moms before me
column5: I ended up changing my baby's diaper in the entry vestibule on a bench. I highly doubt other customers want to see or smell a baby's diaper as they enter a bakery
column6: but I had no other options because I walked there that day. Given that parking can be blocks away
column8: it's not realistic to expect customers to leave and go change the baby in a car either. They really need to install a changing station
column9: as it seems a prime customer base is moms with babies in tow during the weekdays.
